intro: Plectranthus glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered plectranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually purple or violet in color, blooming from late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a valuable addition to both garden and landscape designs.
